objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to introduce ChemCrow, an LLM chemistry agent designed to enhance the performance of large language models in chemistry-related tasks by integrating 18 expert-designed tools. The authors aim to address the limitations of LLMs in chemistry by enabling autonomous planning and execution of chemical syntheses and guiding the discovery of novel compounds.
objective.evidence: We introduce ChemCrow, an LLM chemistry agent designed to accomplish tasks across organic synthesis, drug discovery and materials design. By integrating 18 expert-designed tools and using GPT-4 as the LLM, ChemCrow augments the LLM performance in chemistry, and new capabilities emerge.

knowledge_gap.answer: The paper addresses the gap in the ability of large language models to effectively handle chemistry-related tasks due to their lack of access to external knowledge sources and specialized tools.
knowledge_gap.evidence: These models also lack access to external knowledge sources, limiting their usefulness in scientific applications.

answer: Integration of 18 expert-designed tools with GPT-4 to enhance LLM performance in chemistry.
Autonomous planning and execution of chemical syntheses using a cloud-connected robotic synthesis platform.
Capability to guide the discovery of novel compounds through machine learning models.
evidence: By integrating 18 expert-designed tools and using GPT-4 as the LLM, ChemCrow augments the LLM performance in chemistry, and new capabilities emerge.
ChemCrow autonomously planned and executed the syntheses of an insect repellent and three organocatalysts and guided the discovery of a novel chromophore.
ChemCrow was instructed to train a machine-learning model to help screen a library of candidate chromophores.
